intro: Cryptantha stuebelii, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Boraginaceae family, which is characterized by its hairy stems and showy blue or purple flowers. This species typically grows in arid and semi-arid environments, such as sandy soils and rocky slopes. Its small, tubular flowers bloom in late spring to early summer, attracting pollinators like bees and butterflies. The plant is adapted to survive in harsh, dry conditions with deep roots and a low-growing habit.
